reviewText: For people sick of the Hollywood bilge, these shows were ground-breaking in the '70's and still worth every minute of viewing today.  We adore it!  We watch them regularly - wishing they had never stopped production.  These are nothing like some of the more "racey" British comedies such as Benny Hill or as "madcap" as Mr. Bean.  They have made Anglophiles of us.  Series 1 thru 3 are equally top-rate!

reviewText: "Good Neighbors" is one of the best Britcoms; I would highly recommend it to anybody wanting a good laugh, and it's clean!  Watch for the episode titled "The Windbreak War"- the dialogue is priceless when the two sets of neighbors celebrate the renewal of their friendship with the Good's homemade "Pea-Pod burgundy." The humor is not so essentially British that it doesn't translate across the pond, as some Britcoms are. It's pretty universal. You won't regret purchasing this DVD. Cheers!

reviewText: I got the compleat set season 1 to 3  (season 4 is sold seperatly for some reason but included is the royal command performance)  Tired of the rat race tom good (richard briars) and his wife  barbara (felicity kendal ) decide to become self sufficient he quits his job and rips up his garden to start growing vegis, fruit etc, but it doesnt stop there, they get a goat for milk, pigs ,chickens even a cow at one point, result is hillarious there neighbours think they have gone mad.  In an interview with richard briars he mentions that in real life people were coming up to him in the street wanting to know how to become self sufficient he tells them dont do it apparently people have tryed and its not as easy as you may think.  For lovers of british comedy especialy richard briars (now sadly departed) and felicity kendal this is the d.v.d for you, if you get it make sure to get season 4 as well, you wont regreat it.

reviewText: We tried this show on a whim because we liked the main actor in other shows.  We were surprised at how relateable the scenarios are to todays economy and social aspects.  If a couple tried to be self sufficient in todays suburbs, they would encounter many of the same problems.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a Good Neighbors fanatic. I've only been a fan for about a year and a half and I cannot get enough of the Good Life! I have watched the whole series strait through about 8 to 10 times and it never gets old. Just like some of the other reviewers have stated, "Everytime I watch this series I seem to catch onto something else that I haven't caught onto before, it's just that GOOD!" For some reason I am a bigger fan of the older british comedies than of the newer ones. Good Neighbors is definitely in my top two, right after As Time Goes By, with the awesome Judy Dench. I wish that I could have as interesting friends as the Leadbetters', or the Goods'. These characters are fascinating to watch during the in and outs of both their individual lives, and also of the whitty friendship between the two neighbors. Don't be put off just because this is an older brit comedy. Good Neighbors is one of the best that brit comedy has to offer. You will find yourself watching it over and over again like me. I just wish that such great shows as this one, could go on forever (or at least a little bit longer that this one did). Oh well, at least all of these terrific actors went onto play great roles in something else which we are able to also purchase on amazon, and thank goodness for that!
summary: Does it really have to end?

reviewText: Of course I agree with all the positive reviews.  I just wanted to add that if you're like me and spend a good bit of time alone and watching the tube, these DVD's are a pure joy!  I can watch the seasons thru in little over a day and enjoy each viewing.  The better Brit comedies are endlessly watchable for some reason and over time the characters seem to become your "friends" on some level, its like a refreshing visit each time you see them.  Surely beats most other stuff on TV and won't upset the way politics can and does.

reviewText: This series just keeps getting better. It is indeed a fine example of British comedy. The actors are perfect choices for the roles they play. The writers did an excellent job of tying the previous episode with the present one. Well done.

reviewText: Having purchased Good Neighbors Complete Series 1 - 3 at an earlier date, I was already a fan of this warm, funny show. Series 4 did not disappoint. It takes you further into the lives of two very different, yet connected, couples, and eventually ends the series in a very surprising way. The cast is marvelous; the writing is very special. You can't go wrong with this one!
